Manhattan.description: Manhattan, one of the five boroughs of New York City, is a global cultural, financial, and media hub, divided into distinct sections:

sections.title: Downtown (Lower Manhattan)
sections.content: The financial heart featuring Wall Street and the 9/11 Memorial. Known for its vibrant neighborhoods like Tribeca and the Lower East Side.

sections.title: Midtown
sections.content: The bustling commercial center home to iconic skyscrapers like the Empire State Building, Times Square, and luxury shopping on Fifth Avenue.

sections.title: Upper East Side
sections.content: An affluent area famous for Museum Mile, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art, characterized by elegant residences and upscale living.

sections.title: Upper West Side
sections.content: Known for its proximity to Central Park, cultural institutions like Lincoln Center, and a more relaxed residential vibe.

sections.title: Harlem
sections.content: A cultural touchstone for African American history, known for its jazz clubs, soul food, and arts scene.

sections.title: Washington Heights and Inwood
sections.content: Notable for their large Dominican community, stunning parks like Fort Tryon, and historic sites like the Cloisters.
